member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.CurrentTimemarkProvider
member.summary: Time-mark provider that always returns the current time.
member.remarks: Should only be used for testing purposes.

member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider
member.summary: Timestamp provider for TSA's that implement the DSS Timestamp profile.

remarks.para: Send a DSS-Sign request compliant with the timestamp profile to the TSA.
The call is made via a WCF client,

member.name: F:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.profile
member.summary: The profile identifier to send to the TSA to request a timestamp.
member.value: The profile identifier, defaults to the standard value urn:oasis:names:tc:dss:1.0:profiles:timestamping.

member.name: P:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.Profile
member.summary: The profile identifier to send to the TSA to request a timestamp.
member.value: Gets and sets the profile identifier.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor using default TSA client of the application configuration.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration is searched for a TSA client with the name "Xades.TSA".
The exact configuration requirements depend on the TSA and should be obtained from them.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor using a TSA client with the provided configuration.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration is searched for a TSA client with the provided name.
The exact configuration requirements depend on the TSA and should be obtained from them.

member.param: The configuration name of the TSA client

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.#ctor(Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DSS.TimeStampAuthorityClient)
member.summary: Constructor using a provided TSA client.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration isn't used.
The exact configuration requirements depend on the TSA and should be obtained from them.

member.param: The pre-configured instance of the TSA client.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DssTimestampProvider.GetTimestampFromDocumentHash(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Method used by the library, not not call youself.
member.param: The hash on which the digesht must be calculated
The digest method with which the hash was calculated

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.EHealthP12.Install(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation)
member.summary: Install all the certificates in the correct store.
member.remarks: Installs the certificates with private keys in the "My" store. Installs the root certificates in the "Root" store, if not already present. Installs the intermediate certificates in the "CertificateAuthority" store, if not already present.

member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.EHealthTimestampProvider
member.summary: Timestamp provider for eHealth as TSA.
member.remarks: eHealth has a TSA that uses DSS but defines its own profile that is based on the DSS timestamp profile.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.EHealthTimestampProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor using default TSA client of the application configuration.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration is searched for a TSA client with the name "Xades.TSA".
The eHealth TSA requires the StsBinding as provided by the eH-I codeplex project.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.EHealthTimestampProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor using a TSA client with the provided configuration.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration is searched for a TSA client with the provided name.
The eHealth TSA requires the StsBinding as provided by the eH-I codeplex project.

member.param: The configuration name of the TSA client

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.EHealthTimestampProvider.#ctor(Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.DSS.TimeStampAuthorityClient)
member.summary: Constructor using a provided TSA client.

remarks.para: When this constructor is used, the application configuration isn't used.
The eHealth TSA requires the StsBinding as provided by the eH-I codeplex project.

member.param: The pre-configured instance of the TSA client.

member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.FixedTimemarkProvider
member.summary: Time-mark provider that always returns the provided time.
member.remarks: Should only be used for testing purposes.

member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.ITimestampProvider
member.summary: Interface a Timestamp Provider must implement
member.remarks: The library comes with an implementation for DSS and rfc3161 (TODO), but it is always possible to write your own implementation if required.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.ITimestampProvider.GetTimestampFromDocumentHash(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Method called to request a timestamp.

remarks.para: For implementers, this method should call the TSA to obtain a RFC3161 compliant timestamp token.

member.param: The hash of the document that must be timestamped
The hasm method that was used, in XML-DSIG (and related) format e.g. http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha256
member.returns: Must return a binary version of a RFC3161 compliant timestamp token (not the response) valid for the provided hash

member.name: T:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.Rfc3161TimestampProvider
member.summary: Time-stamp provided via the RFC3161 protocol.
member.remarks: Get a time-stamp via the HTTP protocol.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor that has the Fedict TSA as destination.
member.remarks: You may only use this when you have the explicit agreement of Fedict.

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Constructor that accept the address of the TSA.
member.param: The url of the TSA

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.GetTimestampFromDocumentHash(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Gets a time-stamp of the provided address via the RFC3161.
member.param: The has to get the time-stamp from
The algorithm used to calculate the hash
member.returns: The time-stamp token in binary (encoded) format
member.exception: When the TSA returned a http-error
When the TSA returns an invalid time-stamp response

member.name: M:Egelke.EHealth.Client.Pki.TimeStampTokenHelper.Validate(Org.BouncyCastle.Tsp.TimeStampToken,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Org.BouncyCastle.Asn1.X509.CertificateList}@,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Org.BouncyCastle.Asn1.Ocsp.BasicOcspResponse}@,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
